settings.title: Hotelito By Musa
settings.text: Nestled between the cascading mountains of the Sierra Madres and Mexico’s glittering Pacific, and spanning 165 acres of Arcadian jungle and a one mile stretch of pristine, untouched coastline and a calm lagoon brimming with wildlife, the 11 bedroom boutique Hotelito by Musa is a new beachfront destination for the conscious traveler. A transcendental playground for the young at heart, Musa combines cutting-edge design, architecture, art, music, culinary experiences, relaxation and cultural explorations, conjure countless opportunities for pleasure and illumination.

Hotelito can be considered a microcosm of life in the community. Guests are encouraged to take advantage of all MUSA has to offer, including a mile of virgin beaches, adventure toys for land and sea exploration, social activities, talks, and art activations that blend live installations with music and experiences. Media labs, music studios, and workshop spaces are also in the works. The pragmatic well-being program includes meditation and yoga sessions, a fitness center, spa treatments, and more. A wildlife reserve is home to roaming peacocks, horses, ducks, chickens, and sea turtles. And, of course, the iconic Loma Bonita wave laps at the shore, beckoning surfers.

settings.subheading: meet the hosts - Andrés Saavedra & Tara Medina
settings.title: “MUSA is a beautiful evolution of Andrés’ lifetime of design development, our experiences in community-building through LOOT, and our understanding that hospitality makes spaces come alive.”

settings.question: where to eat?
settings.text: With food practice rooted in sustainability, elegant simplicity, and a resonating authenticity, salute the nightly moon with spirited cocktails and Chef-driven fine dining at ALBA, book a special Chef’s Table experience with the freshest locally sourced ingredients, and enjoy après surf and all-day snacks to sun-drenched soundtracks at Hotelito’s Club de Playa.

settings.question: Special objects in the hotel?
settings.text: Black terrazzo floors were made onsite using stone and granite found on the land, custom tiles and mosaics were crafted by Oaxaca’s Tata Mosaicos, and bespoke Parota and palm wood furnishings were built by local carpenters and makers. Artworks from MUSA’s artist-in-residence program and permanent art collection, featuring such artists as Oso Parado, Brian Eno, Ryan Estep, and Linnea Goransson, decorate walls in guestrooms and public spaces.

settings.question: something most people don't know about hotelito by musa?
settings.text: Rainwater is harvested, biomass is repurposed as mulch, and an artificial reef helps generate healthy aquatic habitats. “When we look back at photos in a few years, we want to see that we’ve made it greener and cleaner, with more trees and more birds,” Andrés Saavedra says. “That will feel like a success.”

settings.title: Take A Peek Inside
settings.text: Featuring thirteen boutique suites and personalised bedrooms featuring curated art and book collections and cool and modern materials sourced and constructed in the region, el Hotelito meets the needs of the modern luxury traveller with sanctuary-like private and communal spaces well-appointed with custom designed furniture, hemp-cotton robes, cloud-like beds dressed with 500 thread count Vivenda and handspun Candor linens, and accented by a custom MUSA scent for a multi-sensory experience.

settings.title: Double ROOM musa 1
settings.description: All rooms offer reliable WiFi, curated minibar, and bedside controls for air conditioning and intelligent lighting. In addition to sleek, open-air ensuites, personal balconies and garden terraces offer either an outdoor bathtub or dipping pool for cooling off and calming down.
